fields_of_interest: Trade, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
eu_initiatives: NGV Global is concerned about emissions regulations, transportation programs with a focus on clean fuels, biomethane activities and renewable transportation fuels, as well as vehicle and engine technologies all related to using natural gas as the principle fuel.  These are applicable to the entire range of transport sector mobility including road vehicles, marine applications and, in future, railway applications. We also follow the related work of CEN for such things as fuel quality and all standards and regulations concerning natural gas and and natural gas vehicles.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Working Group on Motorcycles#E01296#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1296#Member#C#Working Group on Agricultural Tractors#E01297#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1297#Member#C#Working Group on Motor Vehicles#E01295#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1295#Member#C#Emissions (MVEG)
membership:
Society of Gas as a Marine Fuel (SGMF) 
International Gas Union (IGU)
relevant_communication: NGV Global maintains an active website that includes a regular electronic newsletter, updates on regional, national and global standards and regulations related to natural gas and NGVs.  The association hosts a global bi-annual conference and exhibition.  NGV Global is an active member of the International Organzation for Standardization (ISO) and the UNECE regulatory activities in Geneva within the World Forum on the Harmonization of Vehicle Regulations.  We develop position papers on policy, technical papers and host technical meetings on specific issues of importance to the NGV industry and the member companies.
goals__remit:
NGV Global services the rapidly growing natural gas vehicle (NGV) industry worldwide, including water and rail transportation. Together with our network of affiliated associations, we represent approximately 350 companies and organisations. 
 
The prime objective of the Association is to increase the use of natural gas and biomethane for transport and to facilitate efficiency, safety and durability in all areas of the industry.
